title: Meghan Markle's Clothing Collection for Smart Works Is Available to Shop Ahead of Today's Official Launch
text:
The Duchess of Sussex is launching one of her most exciting endeavors yet: later today, Meghan Markle will unveil a very special clothing collection to benefit one of her royal patronages, Smart Works, an organization that helps underprivileged women secure employment.

The line, which was first announced in July, will reportedly include style staples such as a shirt, a blazer, a dress, and a bag. The collection was created in partnership with Meghan's fashion designer friend, Misha Nonoo, the clothing brand Jigsaw, and department stores Marks & Spencer and John Lewis. The goal of this capsule line is to provide women involved with Smart Works with the work-appropriate clothing items required as they enter the workforce.

Meghan has been hard at work on the line throughout her maternity leave, and the royals even shared a behind the scenes look at the line on social media in August. In the sneak peek video, Meghan is seen on set at a photo shoot for the new collection, greeting women involved with the campaign and even helping style one of the pieces on a model.

This marks one of Meghan's biggest projects since welcoming baby Archie in May—in addition to creating this capsule collection, she also guest edited the September issue of British Vogue. Today, the Duchess of Sussex kicked off a busy few weeks by hosting a launch event in honor of the Smart Works line in London.

While the collection officially launches later today, a few pieces are already available online. Shop those styles (and see which ones have already sold out), below.
